summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.Internal.AmazonRecycleBinEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon RecycleBin endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for RecycleBin service requests. Collects values for RecycleBinEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses RecycleBinEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateRule operation. Creates a Recycle Bin retention rule. For more information, see Create Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The retention rule description.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockConfiguration.
Information about the retention rule lock configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleRequest.ResourceTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTags.
Specifies the resource tags to use to identify resources that are to be retained by a tag-level retention rule. For tag-level retention rules, only deleted resources, of the specified resource type, that have one or more of the specified tag key and value pairs are retained. If a resource is deleted, but it does not have any of the specified tag key and value pairs, it is immediately deleted without being retained by the retention rule.
You can add the same tag key and value pair to a maximum or five retention rules.
To create a Region-level retention rule, omit this parameter. A Region-level retention rule does not have any resource tags specified. It retains all deleted resources of the specified resource type in the Region in which the rule is created, even if the resources are not tagged.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The resource type to be retained by the retention rule. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleRequest.RetentionPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetentionPeriod.
Information about the retention period for which the retention rule is to retain resources.

member.summary:

Information about the tags to assign to the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleResponse.LockState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockState.
The lock state for the retention rule.
locked - The retention rule is locked and can't be modified or deleted.
pending_unlock - The retention rule has been unlocked but it is still within the unlock delay period. The retention rule can be modified or deleted only after the unlock delay period has expired.
unlocked - The retention rule is unlocked and it can be modified or deleted by any user with the required permissions.
null - The retention rule has never been locked. Once a retention rule has been locked, it can transition between the locked and unlocked states only; it can never transition back to null.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.CreateRuleResponse.ResourceTags

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListRules operation. Lists the Recycle Bin retention rules in the Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest.LockState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockState.
The lock state of the retention rules to list. Only retention rules with the specified lock state are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token for the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest.ResourceTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTags.
Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The resource type retained by the retention rule. Only retention rules that retain the specified resource type are listed. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To list retention rules that retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To list retention rules that retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListRules operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.ListRulesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Rules.
Information about the retention rules.

member.summary:

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the LockRule operation. Locks a retention rule. A locked retention rule can't be modified or deleted.

member.summary:

The unique ID of the retention rule.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the LockRule operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The retention rule description.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.Identifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
The unique ID of the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.LockConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockConfiguration.
Information about the retention rule lock configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.LockState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockState.
The lock state for the retention rule.
locked - The retention rule is locked and can't be modified or deleted.
pending_unlock - The retention rule has been unlocked but it is still within the unlock delay period. The retention rule can be modified or deleted only after the unlock delay period has expired.
unlocked - The retention rule is unlocked and it can be modified or deleted by any user with the required permissions.
null - The retention rule has never been locked. Once a retention rule has been locked, it can transition between the locked and unlocked states only; it can never transition back to null.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.ResourceTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTags.
Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The resource type retained by the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.RetentionPeriod
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RetentionPeriod.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.RuleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.LockRuleResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The state of the retention rule. Only retention rules that are in the available state retain resources.

unlocked - The retention rule is unlocked and it can be modified or deleted by any user with the required permissions.
null - The retention rule has never been locked. Once a retention rule has been locked, it can transition between the locked and unlocked states only; it can never transition back to null.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRule operation. Updates an existing Recycle Bin retention rule. You can update a retention rule's description, resource tags, and retention period at any time after creation. You can't update a retention rule's resource type after creation. For more information, see
Update Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Identifier.
The unique ID of the retention rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.UpdateRuleRequest.ResourceTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTags.
Specifies the resource tags to use to identify resources that are to be retained by a tag-level retention rule. For tag-level retention rules, only deleted resources, of the specified resource type, that have one or more of the specified tag key and value pairs are retained. If a resource is deleted, but it does not have any of the specified tag key and value pairs, it is immediately deleted without being retained by the retention rule.
You can add the same tag key and value pair to a maximum or five retention rules.
To create a Region-level retention rule, omit this parameter. A Region-level retention rule does not have any resource tags specified. It retains all deleted resources of the specified resource type in the Region in which the rule is created, even if the resources are not tagged.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.RecycleBin.Model.UpdateRuleResponse.LockState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockState.
The lock state for the retention rule.
locked - The retention rule is locked and can't be modified or deleted.
pending_unlock - The retention rule has been unlocked but it is still within the unlock delay period. The retention rule can be modified or deleted only after the unlock delay period has expired.
unlocked - The retention rule is unlocked and it can be modified or deleted by any user with the required permissions.
null - The retention rule has never been locked. Once a retention rule has been locked, it can transition between the locked and unlocked states only; it can never transition back to null.

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.AmazonRecycleBinClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing RecycleBin
This is the Recycle Bin API Reference. This documentation provides descriptions and syntax for each of the actions and data types in Recycle Bin.
Recycle Bin is a resource recovery feature that enables you to restore accidentally deleted snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs. When using Recycle Bin, if your resources are deleted, they are retained in the Recycle Bin for a time period that you specify.
You can restore a resource from the Recycle Bin at any time before its retention period expires. After you restore a resource from the Recycle Bin, the resource is removed from the Recycle Bin, and you can then use it in the same way you use any other resource of that type in your account. If the retention period expires and the resource is not restored, the resource is permanently deleted from the Recycle Bin and is no longer available for recovery. For more information about Recycle Bin, see Recycle Bin in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.RecycleBin.AmazonRecycleBinClient.#ctor

Constructs AmazonRecycleBinClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: T:Amazon.RecycleBin.IAmazonRecycleBin
member.summary:
Interface for accessing RecycleBin
This is the Recycle Bin API Reference. This documentation provides descriptions and syntax for each of the actions and data types in Recycle Bin.
Recycle Bin is a resource recovery feature that enables you to restore accidentally deleted snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs. When using Recycle Bin, if your resources are deleted, they are retained in the Recycle Bin for a time period that you specify.
You can restore a resource from the Recycle Bin at any time before its retention period expires. After you restore a resource from the Recycle Bin, the resource is removed from the Recycle Bin, and you can then use it in the same way you use any other resource of that type in your account. If the retention period expires and the resource is not restored, the resource is permanently deleted from the Recycle Bin and is no longer available for recovery. For more information about Recycle Bin, see Recycle Bin in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.
